om
Class RequestDelegation

java.lang.Object
  om.RequestDelegation
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.io.Serializable, RequestManagement, GracefulFinalization
public class RequestDelegation
extends java.lang.Object
implements RequestManagement

A means of handling a users request through the configuration of different request handlers for the url path. This class utilises the configured composite RequestHandlingConfiguration for delegating a users request appropriately.

Author:
Trevor Hinson
See Also:

allowedIPAddress

protected boolean allowedIPAddress(RequestHandlerSettings rhs,
                                   RequestAssociates ra,
                                   javax.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest request)
                            throws RequestHandlingException
Checks the RequestHandlerSettings to see if we need to check for requiestSecureIP or requiresTrustedIP. If either of these are set to true then we carry out the test itself.

                                RequestHandlerSettings rhs,
                                RequestAssociates ra)
                         throws RequestHandlingException
Checks the settings RequestHandlerEnums.requiresAuthentication of the RequestHandlerSettings and the RequestHandlerEnums.adminUsersOnly and if either are set to true then it delegates to the Authentication implementation to get hold of the users details and check on them.

close

public FinalizedResponse close(java.lang.Object o)
                        throws UtilityException
Description copied from interface: GracefulFinalization
Simple template for the closing of resources within given implementations this method should then be invoked before disposal of the implementor. Where waiting for the finalize method on an implementor is either not sufficient or valid / appropriate. Ensure to invoke the implementation at teh appropriate point also !
